# Complete Guide

> For execution instructions, see [SKILL.md](../SKILL.md)


# Lead Magnet Creation

## When to Use This Skill

- Building email list from scratch
- Converting blog traffic to subscribers
- Offering value in exchange for contact info
- Creating content upgrades for posts
- Launching webinars or courses
- Generating leads from social media

---

## What Is a Lead Magnet?

**Definition:** A valuable free resource offered in exchange for an email address.

**The trade:**
```
Visitor gives: Email (+ name)
You give: Immediate value (guide, template, checklist)
Result: New subscriber you can nurture into customer
```

**Why it works:**
- People value their email‚Äîneed strong incentive
- "Free" isn't enough‚Äîmust be specific and valuable
- Instant gratification (downloadable immediately)
- Builds trust before asking for money

---

## Lead Magnet Types

### 1. Checklists

**Best for:** Step-by-step processes, quality control

**Format:** 1-2 page PDF with checkboxes

**Examples:**
- "Cold Email Checklist: 15 Points Before Sending"
- "SEO Audit Checklist for Blog Posts"
- "Sales Discovery Call Prep Checklist"

**Why it works:**
- Quick to consume (5-10 min)
- Immediately actionable
- Easy to create
- High perceived value

**Template structure:**
```
[Title]
[Subtitle: What this helps you achieve]

‚ñ° Step 1: [Action item]
   ‚Üí [Brief explanation or tip]

‚ñ° Step 2: [Action item]
   ‚Üí [Brief explanation]

[Continue for 10-20 items]

[Footer: Your branding + CTA to main offer]
```

---

### 2. Templates

**Best for:** Reusable frameworks, plug-and-play solutions

**Format:** Google Doc, Notion, Airtable, Canva, or PDF

**Examples:**
- "10 Cold Email Templates That Get 15% Reply Rates"
- "Content Calendar Template (Pre-Filled)"
- "Sales Proposal Template"
- "LinkedIn Profile Swipe File"

**Why it works:**
- Saves time (don't start from scratch)
- Proven to work (social proof)
- Customizable (make it their own)

**What to include:**
- 5-10 templates (variety)
- Fill-in-the-blank format
- Examples of each template in use
- Instructions for customization

---

### 3. Guides/Ebooks

**Best for:** In-depth education, thought leadership

**Format:** 10-30 page PDF

**Examples:**
- "The Complete Guide to Cold Email"
- "How to Build a B2B Sales Pipeline from Scratch"
- "The LinkedIn Lead Generation Playbook"

**Why it works:**
- Comprehensive (solves problem fully)
- Authority-building (positions you as expert)
- High perceived value

**Outline structure:**
```
Cover page
Table of contents
Introduction (why this matters)
Chapter 1: [Main topic]
Chapter 2: [Main topic]
Chapter 3: [Main topic]
...
Conclusion + Next steps
About the author
Call-to-action (book a call, join course, etc.)
```

**Page count by depth:**
- **Quick guide:** 5-10 pages
- **Standard guide:** 10-20 pages
- **Comprehensive ebook:** 20-50 pages

---

### 4. Cheat Sheets

**Best for:** Quick reference, tactical tips

**Format:** 1-2 page PDF (often visual)

**Examples:**
- "50 Cold Email Subject Lines That Convert"
- "SEO Keywords Cheat Sheet for SaaS"
- "Objection Handling Scripts (One-Pager)"

**Why it works:**
- Extremely fast to consume
- Keep it visible (printable, desktop background)
- High shareability

**Format:**
- Single page ideal
- Bullet points or numbered lists
- Visual elements (icons, colors)
- Scannable layout

---

### 5. Toolkits/Swipe Files

**Best for:** Collections of resources

**Format:** ZIP file with multiple documents, or Notion page

**Examples:**
- "The Complete Cold Email Toolkit (Templates + Scripts + Tracker)"
- "Content Marketing Swipe File (50 Examples)"
- "Sales Objection Handling Kit"

**What to include:**
- 3-5 related resources
- Templates
- Examples/case studies
- Instructions doc

**Why it works:**
- High perceived value (bundle)
- One-stop-shop (everything needed)
- Shareable (people refer others)

---

### 6. Calculators/Assessments

**Best for:** Personalized results, data-driven insights

**Format:** Interactive tool (TypeForm, Google Sheets, web app)

**Examples:**
- "ROI Calculator: Cold Email vs. Cold Calling"
- "Sales Quota Attainment Scorecard"
- "Content Marketing Maturity Assessment"

**Why it works:**
- Personalized (tailored to them)
- Engaging (interactive)
- Shareable results

**Structure:**
- 5-10 questions
- Instant results
- Personalized recommendations
- CTA to next step based on score

---

### 7. Video Training/Webinars

**Best for:** Complex topics, building relationship

**Format:** Pre-recorded video or live webinar

**Examples:**
- "How to Build a Cold Email System in 60 Minutes"
- "Live Workshop: LinkedIn Lead Gen Strategy"
- "Video Series: 5 Days to Better Discovery Calls"

**Why it works:**
- Face-to-face connection
- Higher engagement than text
- Can demonstrate (screen share)

**Length:**
- **Short training:** 15-30 min
- **Workshop:** 45-60 min
- **Series:** 5-10 min per video √ó 5-7 videos

---

## Creating High-Converting Lead Magnets

### The 4 Criteria

**1. Specific**
```
‚ùå "Marketing Tips"
‚úÖ "10 LinkedIn Posts That Generated 500 Leads"

‚ùå "Sales Guide"
‚úÖ "The 5-Step Cold Email Framework (With Templates)"
```

**Why:** Specific = valuable. Generic = ignored.

---

**2. Actionable**
```
‚ùå "Theory of Lead Generation"
‚úÖ "Step-by-Step: Build Your Lead Gen System Today"

‚ùå "Understanding SEO"
‚úÖ "SEO Checklist: 20 Things to Do Before Publishing"
```

**Why:** People want results, not theory.

---

**3. Quick Win**
```
‚ùå "12-Month Sales Transformation Program"
‚úÖ "Get Your First 10 Leads This Week"

‚ùå "Complete Marketing Mastery"
‚úÖ "Write 5 Social Posts in 30 Minutes"
```

**Why:** Instant gratification builds trust for bigger commitments.

---

**4. Relevant**
```
For B2B SaaS founders:
‚úÖ "B2B Cold Email Templates"
‚ùå "E-commerce Marketing Guide"

For content creators:
‚úÖ "LinkedIn Content Calendar (Pre-Filled)"
‚ùå "Enterprise Sales Playbook"
```

**Why:** Must solve THEIR specific problem.

---

## Lead Magnet Naming Formula

**Template:**
```
[Format] to [Achieve Result] [Qualifier]

Examples:
"Checklist to Write Cold Emails That Get 15% Replies"
"Template to Build Your Content Calendar in 10 Minutes"
"Guide to Generate 100 B2B Leads Without Ads"
```

**Elements:**
- **Format:** What it is (Checklist, Template, Guide)
- **Result:** What they'll achieve
- **Qualifier:** Timeframe, metric, or "without [pain]"

---

## Design & Formatting

### DIY Tools (Free/Cheap)

**Canva:**
- Pre-made templates for ebooks, checklists
- Drag-and-drop interface
- Export as PDF
- **Cost:** Free (or $13/mo Pro)

**Google Docs:**
- Simple formatting
- Easy sharing
- Collaborative editing
- **Cost:** Free

**Notion:**
- Templates and databases
- Shareable public pages
- Clean, modern design
- **Cost:** Free

---

### Design Best Practices

**Cover page:**
- Eye-catching visual
- Clear title (benefit-driven)
- Your brand/logo
- "Free Download" badge

**Interior:**
- Consistent branding (colors, fonts)
- Plenty of white space
- Headings for scannability
- Visual elements (icons, images)
- Page numbers

**Footer on every page:**
- Your name/company
- Website URL
- Social media handles

**Final page:**
- Clear CTA (next step)
- Link to product/service
- Social proof (testimonials)

---

## Content Creation Process

### Step 1: Choose Topic

**Ask:**
- What question do I get asked most?
- What's the first step someone needs to take?
- What's the biggest pain point my audience has?
- What content of mine performed best?

**Example:**
Top question: "How do I write cold emails that get replies?"
‚Üí Lead magnet: "10 Cold Email Templates That Get 15% Reply Rates"

---

### Step 2: Outline

**For checklist:**
```
Title
Intro (why this matters)
15-20 checklist items
Conclusion + CTA
```

**For guide:**
```
Cover
Table of contents
Introduction
3-5 chapters (main topics)
Conclusion
Next steps/CTA
About the author
```

**For templates:**
```
Introduction (how to use)
Template 1 + example
Template 2 + example
[Repeat]
Customization tips
Next steps
```

---

### Step 3: Write/Create

**Time investment:**
- **Checklist:** 2-3 hours
- **Cheat sheet:** 2-3 hours
- **Template pack:** 3-5 hours
- **Short guide:** 5-10 hours
- **Comprehensive ebook:** 20-40 hours

**Tips:**
- Repurpose existing content (blog posts, videos)
- Use AI for first draft (Claude, ChatGPT)
- Human edit for voice, examples, accuracy
- Add personal stories/insights

---

### Step 4: Design

**If using Canva:**
1. Choose ebook/checklist template
2. Customize colors (match brand)
3. Add your content
4. Insert images/icons
5. Export as PDF

**If using Google Docs:**
1. Format with headings (H1, H2, H3)
2. Add page breaks between sections
3. Insert images (compress first)
4. Download as PDF

---

### Step 5: Create Landing Page

**Elements:**
- Compelling headline (benefit)
- What they'll get (bullet list)
- Social proof (# downloads, testimonial)
- Opt-in form (name + email)
- CTA button
- Preview image (mockup of lead magnet)

**See landing-page-copy.md skill for full details**

---

## Distribution Strategy

### 1. Blog Content Upgrades

**What it is:** Lead magnet specific to blog post topic

**Example:**
```
Blog post: "How to Write Cold Emails"
Content upgrade: "10 Cold Email Templates (Free Download)"

[Inline CTA in blog post]
"Want the templates? Download all 10 here: [link]"
```

**Why it works:**
- Highly relevant (they're already reading about it)
- Higher conversion (30-50% vs. 2-5% generic opt-in)

---

### 2. Website Popups

**Types:**
- **Entry popup:** Shows immediately (annoying, use sparingly)
- **Exit-intent:** Triggers when leaving site (better)
- **Timed:** After 30-60 seconds on page
- **Scroll-triggered:** After scrolling 50-75% of page

**Best practice:**
- Only on blog posts (not homepage)
- Offer relevant lead magnet
- Easy to close (X button)
- Mobile-friendly

---

### 3. Social Media

**LinkedIn:**
```
Post: "I created a free cold email template guide.

Includes 10 proven templates that get 15% reply rates.

Want it? Comment 'TEMPLATE' and I'll DM you the link."
```

**Twitter:**
```
Tweet: "I analyzed 1,000 cold emails.

Here are the 10 templates that performed best.

Free download: [link to landing page]"
```

---

### 4. Email Signature

```
---
[Your Name]
[Title] | [Company]

üìß Get my free cold email templates: [link]
```

---

### 5. YouTube/Podcast

**End of video/episode:**
```
"If you want the templates I mentioned, go to [YourSite.com/templates]

Download them for free‚Äîlink in the description."
```

---

### 6. Paid Ads

**Run ads to lead magnet landing page:**
- Lower cost per lead (free offer vs. paid)
- Build email list
- Nurture into customers via email

**Platforms:**
- LinkedIn Ads (B2B)
- Facebook Ads (B2C or B2B)
- Google Search Ads (high intent keywords)

---

## Delivery Methods

### 1. Instant Download (Best)

**How it works:**
1. User enters email
2. Immediately redirected to download page
3. Also emailed link (backup)

**Why it works:**
- Instant gratification
- No waiting
- Higher satisfaction

**Tools:**
- ConvertKit, MailChimp, ActiveCampaign (built-in)
- Gumroad (for digital products)

---

### 2. Email Delivery

**How it works:**
1. User enters email
2. Receives email with download link
3. Clicks to download

**Why:** Confirms email is valid (reduces fake signups)

**Email template:**
```
Subject: Here's your [Lead Magnet Name]

Hi [Name],

Thanks for downloading [Lead Magnet]!

Here's your download link: [Button: Download Now]

[Brief intro of what's inside]

I'll send you weekly tips on [topic]. If you ever want to stop, just hit unsubscribe.

Talk soon,
[Your name]

P.S. - Reply to this email with your biggest [challenge]. I read every response.
```

---

## Measuring Success

### Key Metrics

**Conversion rate:**
- **Formula:** Opt-ins / Visitors √ó 100
- **Target:**
  - Blog post content upgrade: 20-40%
  - Dedicated landing page: 10-30%
  - Popup: 2-10%
  - Social media post: 1-5%

**Email opens (delivery email):**
- **Target:** 40-60%
- **Low opens:** Test subject line

**Click-through (to download):**
- **Target:** 50-70%
- **Low clicks:** Improve email copy or CTA

**List growth rate:**
- **Formula:** New subscribers / Total subscribers √ó 100
- **Target:** 5-10% per month

---

### Optimization

**If low conversion rate:**
- Test headline (more specific benefit)
- Simplify form (email only vs. name + email)
- Add social proof (X downloads, testimonial)
- Improve landing page copy
- Better preview image

**If high opt-in but low engagement:**
- Lead magnet not delivering value (improve content)
- Wrong audience (refine targeting)
- Delivery issues (check spam filters)

---

## Lead Magnet Funnel

### Full Sequence

```
1. Traffic ‚Üí Landing page
2. Opt-in ‚Üí Download
3. Welcome email (immediate)
4. Email 2 (Day 2): Your story
5. Email 3 (Day 4): Best content
6. Email 4 (Day 7): Case study
7. Email 5 (Day 10): Soft pitch
8. Regular newsletter (weekly)
```

**See email-marketing.md skill for full sequence templates**

---

## Common Mistakes

### ‚ùå Too broad
**Problem:** "Marketing Tips" isn't specific
**Fix:** "10 LinkedIn Posts That Generated 500 Leads"

### ‚ùå Too long
**Problem:** 50-page ebook no one finishes
**Fix:** 5-10 page quick win guide

### ‚ùå No CTA
**Problem:** They download but don't know what's next
**Fix:** Clear CTA in lead magnet (book call, buy product, join community)

### ‚ùå Poor design
**Problem:** Looks unprofessional, hard to read
**Fix:** Use Canva templates, proper formatting

### ‚ùå Not delivering
**Problem:** Download link broken, email not sent
**Fix:** Test the full funnel before promoting

### ‚ùå No follow-up
**Problem:** They download, then crickets
**Fix:** Welcome sequence (5-7 emails)

---

## Pro Tips

### Repurpose Existing Content
- Blog post ‚Üí Checklist
- Video ‚Üí Transcript guide
- Webinar ‚Üí Slides + workbook
- Email series ‚Üí Ebook

**1 hour to repurpose vs. 10 hours to create new**

---

### Create Bundles
Package multiple lead magnets:
```
"The Complete Cold Email Toolkit"
‚Üí Templates (from blog)
‚Üí Subject lines (from video)
‚Üí Checklist (new)
‚Üí Case studies (from emails)

High perceived value, minimal extra work.
```

---

### Gate Your Best Content
```
Blog post: Share 70% of framework
Lead magnet: Full framework + templates

Social post: Tease 3 of 10 tips
Lead magnet: All 10 with examples
```

---

### Use "Cheat Code" Language
```
‚úÖ "Cheat sheet"
‚úÖ "Swipe file"
‚úÖ "Toolkit"
‚úÖ "Ultimate guide"

People love shortcuts.
```

---

### Test Multiple Formats
Same topic, different formats:
```
- Checklist version
- Template version
- Video version

See which converts best, double down.
```

---

## Lead Magnet Checklist

Before launching:

**Content:**
- [ ] Specific (solves one problem)
- [ ] Actionable (can implement today)
- [ ] Quick win (results in <1 week)
- [ ] Relevant to target audience
- [ ] 5-20 pages (not too long)

**Design:**
- [ ] Professional cover
- [ ] Branded (colors, logo)
- [ ] Scannable (headings, bullets)
- [ ] Visual elements (images, icons)
- [ ] CTA on final page

**Landing page:**
- [ ] Compelling headline
- [ ] Clear benefits (bullet list)
- [ ] Social proof
- [ ] Simple form (name + email)
- [ ] Preview image

**Delivery:**
- [ ] Automated delivery setup
- [ ] Download link works
- [ ] Welcome email sequence ready
- [ ] Tracked in email platform
